result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Abigail M Brown Haas

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Abigail M Brown Haas
Current: 13813 Pine Street, Osseo, WI 54758 United States  (Effective: 11-02-2022)
Prior: 12930 7th St, Osseo, WI 54758

(9:27 AM case called.) Defendant Abigail M Brown Haas in court. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Abigail M Brown Haas. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 2: Harboring/Aiding a Felon-Falsify Information.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's Guilty plea and withholds finding of Guilt.

Court places the defendant on a Deferred Acceptance of a Guilty Plea Agreement (DAGP) for 2 years with conditions to include community service. If the defendant is successful on the DAGP, at the end of 2 years the charge will be dismissed. Any remaining charges are dismissed and read in.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 21, 2024 at 09:30 am.
Plea hearing on October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

2:34 PM case called. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Abigail M Brown Haas in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Abigail M Brown Haas. 
Parties are close to an agreement. 
A plea hearing is scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 9:00 (in person, 30 min).
Status conference on August 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

9:19 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Abigail M Brown Haas in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Abigail M Brown Haas. 
Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas- Received by the Court. 
A status conference is scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 2:30 PM (in person, 30 min).

10:05am Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Abigail M Brown Haas in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Abigail M Brown Haas. 

Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 

Case referred to Br. 3 for scheduling an arraignment. 

Bond continues
